page.title: 14Chipstead Village, Surrey.
page.content: Chipstead has a population of somewhere between ninty and a hundred people, who live in fifty-five or so detached houses that have been built in this now affluent area. It is a prime example of a typical southern rural area, maintaining a country atmosphere while being within easy access to both town and city. The peacefulness of the area is most acceptable to the older generation (retired), whose children may well have left for places of more stimulating lifestyles but for those who remain, Chipstead offers a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of city life, nestling in the surrounding farmland. The village boasts a shop cum post office and an antique dealers.
